roleset.name: to grow worse
roleset.note: DETERIORATE-V NOTES: Member of VNcls other_cos-45.4, entity_specific_cos-45.5. (from deteriorate.01-v)
DETERIORATION-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT DF07. Framed by Claire. (from deterioration.01-n)

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: Despite the harsh exchanges , the U.S. and China still seem to be looking for a way to mend relations , which-244 [*T*-244] have deteriorated into what Mr. Nixon referred to as `` the greatest crisis in Chinese-American relations '' since his initial visit to China 17 years ago .
example.arg: into what Mr. Nixon referred to as `` the greatest crisis in Chinese-American relations '' since his initial visit to China 17 years ago

example.name: intransitive
example.text: By October , however , market conditions had deteriorated and the reset notes were targeted o be offered at a yield of between 13 1\/4 % and 13 1\/2 % .

example.name: intransitive with purpose
example.text: Continued strength in the dollar was cited as one reason [0]-2 the trade position may deteriorate [*T*-2].

example.name: intransitive with adverbials
example.text: But traders said the junk bond market increasingly is separating into a top-tier group , in which trades can be executed easily , and a larger group of lower-quality bonds [in which]-3 liquidity -- or the ability to trade without too much difficulty -- has steadily deteriorated this year [*T*-3].
example.arg: liquidity -- or the ability to trade without too much difficulty --
in which -> a larger group of lower-quality bonds

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: If not treated, the acid deterioration of the esophagus may lead to cell mutations which may develop into esophageal cancer.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: This is followed by an assessment of the reasons for the deterioration of the situation into violence.
